Package entities

Class Character

java.lang.Object
entities.Character
All Implemented Interfaces:
CharacterI
Direct Known Subclasses:
Enemy, Player
public abstract class Character
extends java.lang.Object
implements CharacterI
Represents a generic character in the game. This is an abstract class that provides basic properties and behavior for characters, including their name, health, and fire power. Concrete classes such as Player or Enemy can extend this class to provide specific implementations and additional functionality.

    Constructs a new Character with the specified name and fire power.

    • takesDamageFrom

      public void takesDamageFrom​(int damage)
      Reduces the current health of the character based on the damage received. If the resulting health is less than 0, it will be set to 0.
      Specified by:
      takesDamageFrom in interface CharacterI
      Parameters:
      damage - the amount of damage to inflict on the character

    • isAlive

      public boolean isAlive()
      Checks if the character is alive based on their current health.
      Specified by:
      isAlive in interface CharacterI
      Returns:
      true if the character's current health is greater than 0, otherwise false

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
      Compares this character to the specified object for equality. The comparison is based on the name attribute of the character.
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to be compared with this character for equality
      Returns:
      true if the specified object is equal to this character, otherwise false
